intro: Favargera, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to regions in the Americas and thrives in warm, humid climates. Favargera is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in certain areas.
